2.label: basic on/off (triggered at change of the input I1 state and reflecting its state)

3.label: basic on/off (triggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state)

4.label: basic on/off (triggered at sensing moving direction of roller: up=FF, down=0)

5.label: basic on/off (triggered at reaching roller position: bottom=FF, top=0)

6.label: basic on/off (triggered at reaching roller position: bottom=FF, not bottom=0)

7.label: multilevel set (triggered at changes of value of the Flush shutter DC position)

8.label: multilevel set (triggered at changes of value of slats tilting position)

9.label: multilevel sensor report (triggered at change of temperature sensor)

10.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
10.description: Flush 1 relay module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.

options.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

40.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change for Q1 or Q2
40.description: Set value from 0 - 100 (0% - 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power (in Watts) in real time changes for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 1

42.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval for Q1 or Q2
42.description: Set value means time interval (0 - 65535) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 65535 = 1second - 65535 seconds. Reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Default value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s)

71.label: Operating modes
71.description: This parameter defines selection between two available operating modes

72.label: Slats tilting full turn time
72.description:
This parameter defines the time necessary for slats to make full turn (180 degrees)
				default value 150 = 1,5 seconds
				0 - Tilting time disabled
				1 - 32767 = 0,01seconds - 327,67 seconds

73.label: Slats position
73.description:
This parameter defines slats position after up/down movement through Z-wave or push-buttons
				Slats return to previously set position only in case of

options.label: Z-wave control, push-button operation or when the lower limit switch is reached

74.label: Motor moving up/down time
74.description:
This parameter defines shutter motor moving time of complete opening or complete closing.
				Default value 0
				0 - moving time disabled (working with limit switches).
				1 - 65535 = 0,1seconds - 6553,5seconds
				After that time motor is stopped (relay goes to off state)

76.label: Motor operation detection
76.description:
Power threshold to be interpreted when motor reach the limit switch.
				default value 10 = 10W
				0 - 127 = 1-127 W. The value 0 means reaching a limit switch will not be detected.

78.label: Forced Shutter calibration
78.description: By modifying the parameters setting from 0 to 1 a Shutter enters the calibration mode

80.label: Reporting to Controller
80.description: Defines if reporting regarding power level, etc is reported to controller.

85.label: Power consumption max delay time
85.description:
This parameter defines the max time before motor power consumption is read after one of the relays is switched ON.
				If there is no power consumption during this max time (motor not connected, damaged or requires higher time to start, motor in end position) the relay will switch OFF.
				Time is defined by entering it manually.
				default value 0 = time is set automatically
				3 - 50 = 0,3seconds - 5seconds (100ms resolution)

86.label: Power consumption at limit switch delay time
86.description: Sets the time delay for detecting limit switches

90.label: Time delay for next motor movement
90.description:
This parameter defines the minimum time delay between next motor movement (minimum time between switching motor off and on again).
				default value 5 = 500ms
				1 - 30 = 0,1seconds - 3seconds (100ms resolution)

110.label: Temperature sensor offset settings
110.description:
Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor.
				default value 32536
				32536 - offset is 0.0C
				From 1 to 100 - value from 0.1 C to 10.0 C is added to actual measured temperature.
				From 1001 to 1100 - value from -0.1 C to -10.0 C is subtracted to actual measured temperature.

120.label: Digital temperature sensor reporting
120.description:
If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter
				default value 5 = 0,5C
				0 - Reporting disabled
				1-127 = 0,1C - 12,7C, step is 0,1C
